resources.string: Steady there, sailor.\n\nYou are safe now, and among the living.
The storm that wrecked your ship was caused by an unnatural force known here as Corruption.\n\nIt encircles the island, smashing ships and leaving the crew either dead… or worse.
This beach is not a hospitable place, but you are welcome to visit the Windsward settlement.\n\nAfter we are done here, of course.
Unfortunately, the Lost are the least of our problems. \n\nThat storm was the worst I've ever seen. I fear some remnant of Corruption remains in this area.
Purging the Corruption in the sea cave has undoubtedly dealt with the immediate threat.\n\nBut the fact it spread to shore at all is still a serious cause for concern.
Strangely, there have been no further Corruption storms since the one that marked your arrival.\n\nIt's as if the evil is collecting itself, preparing to unleash holy hell.
It was quite sweet of Deepti to send you down here… and quite generous of you to come.\n\nI thank you, my friend, from the bottom of my heart.
Haha! Look here! It always makes my day to greet someone new!\n\nWelcome to Windsward! Find me in the tavern later and I'll buy you a flagon of mead!
Shattered Mountain's started spewing Corruption again, too. It's going to be a long day!\n\nShould've listened to that old fool years ago. Oh well, bygones!
I've decided to start amassing resources, supplies, anything we could possibly need.\n\nWhen the Corruption comes, we'll be good and ready for it!
From now on, we'll be posting any supply requests to the town board.\n\nVisit the board or just come talk to me, and if you want to take something on, go for it!
Well now, I hear you've thrown in with the {playerFaction}… I think that makes sense.\n\nBut I hope you're still willing to fight with your old friend Miklos as well!
The truth is that Monarch's Bluffs has been particularly dismissive of my efforts to work together.\n\nI wonder if one of our other neighbors would be more receptive.
{playerName}, it's good to see you. Still no word from First Light. It's… discouraging.\n\nI haven't told anyone else, but our circumstances are worse than people realize.
On second thought, that drink I promised in the tavern - let's put a hold on that.\n\nI think I want to celebrate our successes sober, my friend!
If it's true that Corruption is spreading rapidly now, then we must prepare.\n\nBut there's no need to rush - we will take this one step at a time.
You are now officially a resident of Windsward, whether that is temporary or not.\n\nAnd that means you should become acquainted with the settlement.
It seems Constable Dauti has taken quite a liking to you.\n\nHe already wants to rope you into his grand plans for the settlement.
Of course, many around town find Constable Dauti to be the most frustrating.\n\nI'm feeling a little impatient with him myself.
You must choose for yourself which faction is best-aligned with your principles.\n\nI know my choice, but I will keep that to myself.
I am grateful to see the Factions taking a proactive role in defending the territory.\n\nBut I worry that their squabbling could give the Corrupted an advantage.
The more I think on our situation, the less I feel we can handle something of this magnitude. We know precious little about Corruption, in the end.\n\nWe need to find someone who can advise us.
Pardon me, my friend, but I must ask - have you seen Watcher Fayed return from the beach?\n\nIt's been some time, and I'm starting to worry.
I think having a surplus of textiles now might actually help us address another one of our shortages.\n\nI've heard Monarch's Bluffs is short on textiles as well.
Well now, I think we're headed in the right direction, thanks to you.\n\nWatcher Fayed still hasn't returned from the beach, however. I'm quite concerned.
Finally! Thank you for going down to the beach, {playerName}, and for recovering our box.\n\nTahir finally came home, at least for a short while. I know not where he has gone now.
Welcome to Windsward, friend. \n\nI believe you'll find this is the best territory and the best settlement in all Aeternum.
Miklos means well, to be sure. He's just… well, more of a 'talker' than a 'doer.'\n\nSuits me just fine, however, as I'm exactly the opposite.
I should hope I'll see you around the forge often then. You're welcome to use it anytime.\n\nSkills like yours shouldn't go to waste.

Not much happening at the forge. We have a shortage of metals in Windsward and the spread of Corruption has slowed trade. \n\nBut I wonder - are conventional weapons really the best means of fighting the Corruption?
While I perform experiments on these soil samples, I wonder if you'd humor me further.\n\nFair warning - this request might be more disgusting than dirty.
Based on what seems apparent from studying the soil samples and the sludge, I found something.\n\nI found a way to fight against the Corruption!
I think I'm on to something - a way to catalyze the fulminate!\n\nThis next batch of bombs will blow the Corrupted to smithereens!
Keep moving, stranger. Far as I know, we got nothing to talk about.
Look, I hate to be harsh, but survival is not always a given here. \n\nWhether outside or in, people do die, or worse, become Corrupted, Lost. None of us get a free pass.
Alright, I'll offer you one tip no one ever seems to remember.\n\nYour camp is your real home - set it somewhere so that if you do die, you're not too far from camp.
So you joined a faction? Better you than me is all I got to say.\n\nBut hey, maybe you and your friends can take some of the load off me.
Alright then, let's see how mean a hunter you really are…\n\nHow about dealing with a situation that even I'm a little leery of?
Maybe I should pitching in a little more to help the settlement, you know?\n\nI heard Sandris talking to himself about something.
Hey, you know what? I owe you a debt of gratitude.\n\nMaking those tinderboxes is the first time I've done something for someone in a long time, but it felt good.
Hello there, young traveler! Join me for a drink? \n\nIt's never too early… or too late for one more cup.
You know, it's funny - when I first heard the Corruption was spreading, I thought we'd be safe here in Windsward.\n\nBut I tell it to you plain - I'm beginning to have doubts.
When I say this stew is going to be delicious, I mean DELICIOUS.\n\nBut it would be a lot better if it had something to go with it.
You know what you are? A Gastronomical Crusader! Fighting the good fight for food everywhere!\n\nYou're really an inspiration - feels like I finally have someone I can rely on.

With a good meal in the works, let's discuss more audacious undertakings, shall we?\n\nThe Lost Pirates that hit that caravan have plagued Windsward for years, and I think it's time we show 'em what for.
Now with all you've accomplished, it's time to celebrate!\n\nTake a load off, why don't you? Get some rest before the Corrupted come. Hehe.
Oh dear, you spooked me! Needless to say, I'm a little nervous wandering around out here on my own.
Oh dear, you spooked me! Needless to say, I'm a little nervous wandering around out here on my own.\n\nI must complete my collection, however, whatever risk it requires.
It's clear they were capable of harnessing some type of energy to aid in their construction.\n\nBut I believe there was some labor involved as well.
The items you helped add to my collection suggest multiple possibilities for the Ancients' construction methods.\n\nDo return some time and we shall explore these matters further.
Well now, I'm almost starting to think of you as an old friend.\n\nDon't go disappearing on me, now. I'm still mourning the loss of my best friend and former colleague.
The Eyepiece is even more useful than I remembered. Thank you for retrieving it.
Welcome to 'The Southern Breeze'! May a gentle wind always guide you home!\n\nDo you wish to check in? We'd be happy to have you!
You've become a real regular around here, haven't you? Hope this place is starting to feel comfortable.\n\nI have a question however, do you ever venture outside the settlement?
Now that you caught a glimpse of Everfall, I trust you see how special Windsward is.\n\nThe Southern Breeze will always lull you to sleep!
Despite times being crazy as they are, I hear there are opportunities out there to earn some extra azoth.\n\nIf I had your abilities, I'm not sure I'd waste my time in Windsward.
I'm never one to turn away a customer.\n\nBut you've been here some time - might want to look into buying a house, really making an investment.
Hello, I'm Master Fisher Shields.
Hello, I'm Master Fisher Shields.
How goes your fishing, {playerName}?
How goes your fishing, {playerName}?
Whine, whine…
Woof!
Bark, bark! (Barkimedes looks happy to see you.)
Bark, bark! (Barkimedes looks happy to see you.)
